programme.title: 2024 Men's College World Series
programme.desc: Game 4.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: 2024 Stanley Cup Final
programme.desc: Sergei Bobrovsky and the Panthers seek a series sweep of the Oilers in Game 4 of the Stanley Cup Final. Bobrovsky, the Conn Smythe Trophy favorite, stopped 82-of-86 shots over the first three games, including 32-of-35 in a 4-3 victory in Game 3.

programme.title: 2024 Men's College World Series
programme.desc: Game 5.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Yankees send out Marcus Stroman in a primetime series finale against the Red Sox. Stroman (6-2, 2.82 ERA) is 4-0 with a 1.70 ERA over his last six starts, and is 7-4 with a 3.51 mark versus Boston, holding Rafael Devers to one hit in 10 at-bats.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: 2024 Men's College World Series
programme.desc: From Charles Schwab Field Omaha in Omaha, Neb.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: 2024 NBA Finals
programme.desc: The Celtics return to Boston looking to clinch the 2024 NBA Finals in Game 5 against the Mavericks. Dallas prevented Boston from celebrating a title in Texas with a 122-84 Game 4 victory. Luka Doncic paced the Mavs with 29 points in that match.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Perez vs. Taira - Prelims
programme.desc: Melquizael Costa vs. Shayilan Nuerdanbieke, featherweight; Jeka Saragih vs. Westin Wilson, featherweight; Carli Judice vs. Gabriella Fernandes, flyweight; Jimmy Flick vs. Nate Maness, flyweight. From UFC Apex in Las Vegas.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Perez vs. Taira
programme.desc: Brady Hiestand vs. Garett Armfield, bantamweight; Timmy Cuamba vs. Lucas Almeida, featherweight; Douglas Silva de Andrade vs. Miles Johns, bantamweight; Alex Perez vs. Tatsuro Taira, flyweight. From UFC Apex in Las Vegas.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Through interviews with Isiah Thomas, Bill Laimbeer, Joe Dumars, Dennis Rodman, Adrian Dantley, Mark Aguirre and others, viewers are provided an inside look at what made the Detroit Pistons, of the late 80's and early 90's, tick.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Orlando Magic are considered the fairytale team of the mid-'90s whose popularity grew, in part, due to players like Shaquille O'Neal and Penny Hardaway.

programme.title: 2024 AKC Disc Dog Challenge
programme.desc: Top canine athletes, and their owners, compete in flying disc games to determine a champion.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: MLB Productions chronicles the 2004 American League playoff series between the Yankees and Red Sox that made baseball history and finally put an end to the "Curse of the Bambino."

programme.title: World of X Games
programme.desc: The story of skateboarder Ryan Sheckler - a prodigy, MTV star, X Games gold medalist and hard-partier - as told in his own words.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: On June 15, 2011, Vancouver hosts Game 7 of the Stanley Cup Finals between the Canucks and Boston Bruins; the city is a hive of nervous energy with the home team on the verge of its first-ever title, but when Boston stuns the Canucks to win the Cup, the situation quickly devolves into a full-blown riot, an orgy of violence that sees cars overturned and burned, windows shattered, businesses looted, and lawlessness reign... as hundreds of cell phone cameras capture it all.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Filmmaker Brett Morgen chronicles events: Arnold Palmer plays his last round at a U.S. Open, the FIFA World Cup kicks off in Chicago, the Rangers celebrate on Broadway, O.J. Simpson leads America on a slow speed chase in a white Ford Bronco.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship hockey show featuring highlights, news, analysis, speed, skill and access to the biggest stars, stories and personalities of the game. Hosted by John Buccigross.

programme.title: Major League Rugby
programme.desc: From SaberCats Stadium in Houston.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: Professional players and poker-loving celebrities are joined by players who won seats at the table through auditions and free qualifiers.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Diamondbacks and White Sox continue a three-game interleague series with the second match. On June 15, 2005, Hall of Fame slugger Frank Thomas took Russ Ortiz deep for one of his 521 career home runs to help push Chicago past Arizona 12-6.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Spain takes on Croatia in Berlin in Group B of the 2024 European Championships. These nations have been drawn together for the fourth successive EUROs. This includes Spain winning 5-3 after extra time in Copenhagen in the EURO 2020 round of last 16.

programme.title: UEFA European Football Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights from the European Championship event.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: From Fenway Park in Boston.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Italy plays Albania in Dortmund in Group B of the 2024 European Championships. Italy has won all four matches against Albania. The most recent of those games was a 3-1 friendly victory in Tirana on Nov. 16, 2022 (including two Vincenzo Grifo goals).

programme.title: Euro Today
programme.desc: The latest news and analyses from the UEFA European Championship.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Poland is up against Netherlands in Hamburg in Group D of the European Championships. Poland is winless in 12 matches versus Netherlands, since a 2-0 EURO qualifying victory in Chorzów on May 2, 1979 (goals by Zbigniew Boniek and Wlodzimierz Mazur).

programme.title: Euro Today
programme.desc: The latest news and analyses from the UEFA European Championship.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Slovenia is up against Denmark in Stuttgart in Group C of EURO 2024. Slovenia is winless in all six matches versus Denmark, only avoiding defeat in a 1-1 EURO qualifying draw in Ljubljana on June 19, 2023 (goals by Andraz Sporar and Rasmus Højlund).

programme.title: Horse Racing
programme.desc: The best racehorses square off in the premiere races from across the country.

programme.title: Major League Rugby
programme.desc: From Veterans Memorial Stadium in Quincy, Mass.

programme.title: Horse Racing
programme.desc: Following all the action from the world of horse racing.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Serbia is up against England in Gelsenkirchen in Group C of EURO 2024. The only major tournament meeting was Yugoslavia's 1-0 win in Florence in the EURO 1968 semi-finals. Dragan Dzajic scored the goal and the Three Lions had Alan Mullery sent off.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Poland is up against Netherlands in Hamburg in Group D of the European Championships. Poland is winless in 12 matches versus Netherlands, since a 2-0 EURO qualifying victory in Chorzów on May 2, 1979 (goals by Zbigniew Boniek and Wlodzimierz Mazur).

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: The Stallions and Brahmas meet in the inaugural UFL championship game. Birmingham trailed by 15 points late in the second quarter, but rallied to beat Michigan 31-18 for the USFL Conference title. San Antonio ousted St. Louis 25-15 in the XFL final.

programme.desc: Belgium plays Slovakia in Frankfurt am Main in Group E of EURO 2024. This is the first competitive game between these nations. The most recent meeting was a 2-1 friendly win for Belgium in Bruges on Feb. 6, 2013 (90th-minute winner by Dries Mertens).

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: NL Central foes begin their yearly set as the Reds visit the Pirates. Pittsburgh is 20-12 against Cincinnati over the last two seasons, including an 8-5 mark last year. Bryan Reynolds (PIT) tallied four homers and nine RBIs in the 2023 games.

programme.desc: Austria contests France in Düsseldorf in Group D of EURO 2024. Both major tournament meetings were at the World Cup. Austria won 3-2 after extra time in Turin in the 1934 round of last 16 and France won 1-0 in Madrid in the 1982 second group stage.
